Package org.cyclops.commoncapabilities.api.capability.wrench

Interface IWrench

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultWrench
public interface IWrench
Indicates that something can be used as wrench. This must be used by targets (like blocks or entities) to determine if the thing that activated them is a wrench. The target is responsible for checking if the wrench can be used for this target using canUse(Player, WrenchTarget). If it can be used, the target must first call beforeUse(Player, WrenchTarget). After that the target can call its own logic. Finally, the target must call afterUse(Player, WrenchTarget).

  • Method Details

    • canUse

      boolean canUse(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, WrenchTarget target)
      Check if this wrench can be used.
      Parameters:
      player - The player.
      target - The target that is being wrenched.
      Returns:
      If it can be used.

    • beforeUse

      void beforeUse(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, WrenchTarget target)
      Called before the wrench is being used after the canUse check if done. Useful for preparing some things for the wrench-action.
      Parameters:
      player - The player.
      target - The target that is being wrenched.

    • afterUse

      void afterUse(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, WrenchTarget target)
      Called after the wrench is used. Useful for doing cleanup work, or consuming energy.
      Parameters:
      player - The player.
      target - The target that is being wrenched.
